cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 195 miles south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northeast across the Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle, then forecast to sweep across the Southeast United States and move offshore of North Carolina into the western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Panama City, Florida (northern Gulf Coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches posted north of the Carolinas; current watches confined to parts of the Gulf Coast.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from the Mississippi/Alabama border to Yankeetown, FL and from Grand Isle, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River; Storm Surge Warning Indian Pass, FL to Clearwater Beach, FL.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast, then inland across GA/SC/NC before emerging into the Atlantic south of the Mid-Atlantic states.
weather_observation.wind: Only a small (≤3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm–force winds; gusts to 20–30 mph possible late Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Delaware River/upper Delaware Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Monday into Tuesday as the post-tropical remnant passes offshore.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minimal; any tornado threat should remain well south of the port.
